subject: General English
question_en: Read the sentence and find out the part which has an error: 'Each of the players / have to bring / his own kit / for the match.'
question_hi: वाक्य को पढ़िए और उस भाग को चुनिए जिसमें त्रुटि है: 'Each of the players / have to bring / his own kit / for the match.'
explanation_en: With 'Each of + plural noun' the verb is singular, so 'has to bring' is correct.
explanation_hi: 'Each of + plural noun' के साथ क्रिया singular होती है, इसलिए 'has to bring' सही है।

subject: General English
question_en: Spot the error: 'The manager along with his assistants / are attending / the conference / tomorrow.'
question_hi: त्रुटि खोजें: 'The manager along with his assistants / are attending / the conference / tomorrow.'
A_en: The manager along with his assistants
A_hi: The manager along with his assistants
explanation_en: When two subjects are joined by 'along with', the verb agrees with the first subject; 'manager' is singular, so 'is attending' is correct.
explanation_hi: जब दो subject 'along with' से जुड़े हों, तो क्रिया पहले subject के अनुसार होती है; 'manager' singular है, इसलिए 'is attending' सही है।

subject: General English
question_en: Identify the error: 'One of my friends / who lives in Ajmer / work in a bank / as a clerk.'
question_hi: त्रुटि पहचानें: 'One of my friends / who lives in Ajmer / work in a bank / as a clerk.'
explanation_en: The relative pronoun 'who' refers to 'one', so the verb should be singular 'works'.
explanation_hi: Relative pronoun 'who' 'one' को point करता है, इसलिए क्रिया singular 'works' होनी चाहिए।

subject: General English
question_en: Find the incorrect part: 'Scarcely had I reached the station / than the train / started moving / towards Delhi.'
question_hi: गलत भाग ढूंढें: 'Scarcely had I reached the station / than the train / started moving / towards Delhi.'
A_en: Scarcely had I reached the station
A_hi: Scarcely had I reached the station
explanation_en: With 'scarcely...when' is the correct correlative conjunction, not 'than'.

subject: General English
question_en: Choose the part with the error: 'The number of applications / have increased / this year / due to new vacancies.'
question_hi: गलत भाग चुनें: 'The number of applications / have increased / this year / due to new vacancies.'
explanation_en: 'The number of' takes a singular verb, so 'has increased' is correct.
explanation_hi: 'The number of' के बाद singular verb आता है, इसलिए 'has increased' सही है।

subject: General English
question_en: Spot the mistake: 'She is the most wisest girl / I have ever met / in my entire / teaching career.'
question_hi: गलती ढूंढें: 'She is the most wisest girl / I have ever met / in my entire / teaching career.'
A_en: She is the most wisest girl
A_hi: She is the most wisest girl
explanation_en: 'Wisest' is already a superlative; double superlative 'most wisest' is incorrect.
explanation_hi: 'Wisest' पहले ही superlative है; दोहरा superlative 'most wisest' गलत है।

subject: General English
question_en: Find the error: 'I look forward / to meet / you / next week.'
question_hi: त्रुटि खोजें: 'I look forward / to meet / you / next week.'
explanation_en: The phrase 'look forward to' is followed by a gerund, so 'to meeting' is correct.
explanation_hi: Phrase 'look forward to' के बाद gerund आता है, इसलिए 'to meeting' सही है।

subject: General English
question_en: Identify the incorrect part: 'Neither of these books / are / useful for / competitive exams.'
question_hi: गलत भाग पहचानें: 'Neither of these books / are / useful for / competitive exams.'
explanation_en: 'Neither' is singular, so the verb should be 'is'.
explanation_hi: 'Neither' singular होता है, इसलिए क्रिया 'is' होनी चाहिए।

subject: General English
question_en: Choose the erroneous part: 'The committee / have submitted / its report / to the minister.'
question_hi: गलत भाग चुनें: 'The committee / have submitted / its report / to the minister.'
explanation_en: When 'committee' is taken as a single unit, it takes a singular verb 'has submitted'.
explanation_hi: जब 'committee' को एक single unit माना जाए तो singular verb 'has submitted' आएगी।

subject: General English
question_en: Spot the error: 'He said that / he will meet me / at the station / at 5 p.m.'
question_hi: त्रुटि ढूंढें: 'He said that / he will meet me / at the station / at 5 p.m.'
explanation_en: In reported speech, change of tense is needed: 'he would meet me' is correct.
explanation_hi: Reported speech में tense बदलना जरूरी है: 'he would meet me' सही है।
